rules: Rule1: If the City Council receives funding for the Conservation Program, then Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative

Rule2: Either the Community Group organizes volunteers for the Monitoring Program, or if Urban Wildlife does not achieve conservation goals through the Initiative, then the Conservation Team implements an emergency plan for Habitat Crisis
Rule3: Either the Research Team analyzes data from Camera Footage or the Research Team publishes findings on Urban Ecology

Rule4: If the Research Team publishes findings on Urban Ecology, then either the Research Team installs cameras for Wildlife Monitoring or Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative

Rule5: If the Conservation Team launches an awareness campaign for Public Education, then should the Research Team analyze data from Camera Footage, it follows that either the Research Team installs cameras for Wildlife Monitoring or Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative
Rule6: If the Education Team develops curriculum for Wildlife Conservation, then the Conservation Team partners with schools for the Youth Program
Rule7: Either the Education Team develops curriculum for Wildlife Conservation or the Conservation Team hosts workshops for Community Engagement
Rule8: If the Conservation Team hosts workshops for Community Engagement, then the Conservation Team distributes materials for Educational Resources
Rule9: If the Conservation Team distributes materials for Educational Resources, then the Conservation Team launches an awareness campaign for Public Education
Rule10: If the Wildlife Foundation receives funding for the Conservation Program, then Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative

Rule11: If Park Services allocates resources for Habitat Management, then provided that Park Services maintains habitats in Green Spaces, Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative

Rule12: Either Local Residents oppose development of the Construction Project, or the City Council receives funding for the Conservation Program, or the Wildlife Foundation receives funding for the Conservation Program
Rule13: If the Business Association supports conservation of the Wildlife Plan, then Local Residents do not oppose development of the Construction Project
Rule14: Either the Business Association supports conservation of the Wildlife Plan or the Development Firm proposes compromise on the Modified Project
Rule15: If the Development Firm proposes compromise on the Modified Project, then the Development Firm includes green spaces in the Building Design
Rule16: If the Development Firm includes green spaces in the Building Design, then Local Residents do not oppose development of the Construction Project
Rule17: Either the Transport Department monitors vehicle collisions at Wildlife Crossings or the Transport Department installs warning signs for Animal Crossing
Rule18: If the Transport Department installs warning signs for Animal Crossing, then Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative
Rule19: If the University receives grant for Research Funding, then the Research Team studies migration patterns of Wildlife Movement
Rule20: Either the University receives grant for Research Funding or the University collaborates on research with the Conservation Team

Rule21: If the University collaborates on research with the Conservation Team, then under the condition that the Transport Department monitors vehicle collisions at Wildlife Crossings, the Conservation Team establishes protocol for Animal Rescue
Rule22: If City Planning approves permits for Wildlife Corridors, then the Research Team conducts a survey of Urban Foxes
Rule23: Either City Planning approves permits for Wildlife Corridors or the Environmental Agency approves permits for Wildlife Corridors

Rule24: If the Environmental Agency approves permits for Wildlife Corridors, then either the City Council receives funding for the Conservation Program or the Wildlife Foundation receives funding for the Conservation Program

Rule25: If the Research Team conducts a survey of Urban Foxes, then either the City Council receives funding for the Conservation Program or the Wildlife Foundation receives funding for the Conservation Program
Rule26: If the Conservation Team trains staff in Rescue Procedures, then the Conservation Team establishes protocol for Animal Rescue
Rule27: Either the Conservation Team trains staff in Rescue Procedures or the Conservation Team hires a veterinarian for Wildlife Care
Rule28: If the Conservation Team hires a veterinarian for Wildlife Care, then Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative
facts: Fact1: Park Services maintains habitats in Green Spaces
Fact2: Park Services allocates resources for Habitat Management
Fact3: The Community Group does not organize volunteers for the Monitoring Program
Fact4: The Research Team does not install cameras for Wildlife Monitoring
Fact5: The Conservation Team does not partner with schools for the Youth Program
Fact6: The Research Team does not study migration patterns of Wildlife Movement
Fact7: The Conservation Team does not establish protocol for Animal Rescue
Fact8: The Conservation Team does not implement an emergency plan for Habitat Crisis

question: Urban Wildlife achieves conservation goals through the Initiative
